summary.para: Describes the capabilities of a Microsoft Direct3D 11 video processor.

remarks.para: The video processor stores state information for each input stream. These states persist between blits. With each blit, the application selects which streams to enable or disable. Disabling a stream does not affect the state information for that stream.

The MaxStreamStates member gives the maximum number of stream states that can be saved. The MaxInputStreams member gives the maximum number of streams that can be enabled during a blit. These two values can differ.
